meanings.definition: Used by a speaker to refer to himself or herself and one or more other people as the object of a verb or preposition.
meanings.sent1: When we go to the park, we bring snacks for everyone.
meanings.sent2: We are going to the store to buy groceries.
meanings.sent3: We pretended to be superheroes and saved the day!
meanings.sent4: In this team, we are the glue that holds everything together.
meanings.sent5: As a family, we stick together through thick and thin.

meanings.definition: Used to refer to people in general.
meanings.sent1: We all need to work together to make the world a better place.
meanings.sent2: When we are kind to others, we create a positive environment.
meanings.sent3: We humans have a tendency to overcomplicate simple things.
meanings.sent4: In the grand scheme of things, we are just tiny specks in the universe.
meanings.sent5: As a society, we must strive for equality and justice for all.
